ClsC_923cce05.class_description: Core elements within urban legend narratives, including the tempting object used in the story and the audience who receives the implied warning.
ClsC_923cce05.evidence_excerpt: Stories of strangers luring children with candy ... warn listeners about the dangers

members.entity_description: Sweets used as bait by strangers in cautionary tales about child luring.
members.resolution_context: Stories of strangers luring children with candy, haunted houses with dark pasts, and cursed objects warn listeners about the dangers that lurk in the world around them.

members.entity_description: People who hear these urban legends and receive the implied warnings about danger.
members.resolution_context: Stories of strangers luring children with candy, haunted houses with dark pasts, and cursed objects warn listeners about the dangers that lurk in the world around them.

ClsC_e7809bd9.class_description: Physical parts of plants that serve as environmental structures for caterpillar behavior or camouflage, such as attachment sites or visual backgrounds.
ClsC_e7809bd9.evidence_excerpt: Leaves, stems, and twigs are plant parts used as background or attachment points.

members.entity_description: Plant leaves that are visually imitated by certain caterpillars for concealment.
members.resolution_context: Some caterpillars have spines or hairs for protection, while others mimic the appearance of twigs or leaves to camouflage themselves from predators. Leaves are part of the background environment used for mimicry.

members.entity_description: Plant stem that serves as an attachment point for the caterpillar before forming a chrysalis.
members.resolution_context: The caterpillar attaches itself to a leaf or stem and forms a protective shell around itself called a chrysalis.

members.entity_description: Small plant branches whose appearance is mimicked by some caterpillars.
members.resolution_context: Some caterpillars have spines or hairs for protection, while others mimic the appearance of twigs or leaves to camouflage themselves from predators. Twigs are the plant structures being visually copied.

ClsC_a5a9cb4b.class_description: Distinct developmental stages in the butterfly life cycle, from egg to larval caterpillar, treated as organismal life stages rather than specific anatomical parts.
ClsC_a5a9cb4b.evidence_excerpt: egg life stage and larval life stage (caterpillar) within the butterfly life cycle

members.entity_description: The initial life stage of a butterfly during which the organism exists as eggs laid on host plants before hatching into larvae (caterpillars), with eggs varying in size, shape, and color by species.
members.resolution_context: Both entities describe the same biological concept: butterflies in their egg life stage, differing only in phrasing and type granularity.

members.entity_description: The larval life stage of butterflies, beginning when the egg hatches into a caterpillar and encompassing the primary feeding, rapid growth, and preparation for pupation.
members.resolution_context: All three describe the same biological entity: the butterfly larval stage (caterpillar), differing only in wording and type hints.

ClsC_f990e905.class_description: Adult butterflies as whole organisms, including general references to butterflies and sex-specific subsets such as females that lay eggs.
ClsC_f990e905.evidence_excerpt: adult butterflies, including female butterflies that lay eggs on host plants

members.entity_description: A butterfly, an insect of the order Lepidoptera that undergoes complete metamorphosis through egg, larva (caterpillar), pupa (chrysalis), and adult stages.
members.resolution_context: All four mentions refer to the same biological organism (butterflies in general and the adult butterfly) within the same life-cycle context, differing only in plurality or stage emphasis.

members.entity_description: Adult butterflies of the female sex that lay eggs on specific host plants to begin the next generation.
members.resolution_context: Both mentions refer to the same sex-specific subset of adult butterflies responsible for egg laying within the life cycle context.

ClsC_a4260d60.class_description: Groups of people described as worldwide recipients or bearers of stories and legends. Includes any phrasing that denotes a global population or audience.
ClsC_a4260d60.evidence_excerpt: people around the world; global audience who can receive urban legends

members.entity_description: Global population whose imagination and curiosity are captured by urban legends.
members.resolution_context: These tales, often passed down through generations, capture the imagination and curiosity of people around the world.

members.entity_description: Worldwide collection of people who can receive urban legends via internet and social media.
members.resolution_context: In the age of the internet and social media, stories can be shared and disseminated at lightning speed, reaching a global audience in a matter of seconds.

ClsC_d0f55bc4.class_description: Concepts and processes specifically concerned with urban legends as a form of modern folklore, including their nature and how they spread and proliferate in society.
ClsC_d0f55bc4.evidence_excerpt: Urban legends as modern folklore and their spread and proliferation across regions and media.

members.entity_description: A category of modern folklore stories, such as the Hook Man, that circulate widely within communities through oral and digital transmission.
members.resolution_context: While the specifics of the story may vary, the underlying fear of the unknown and the threat of danger remain constant in urban legends like the "Hook Man.

members.entity_description: Dissemination of urban legends across regions and continents.
members.resolution_context: As societies became more interconnected through trade and travel, urban legends began to spread across regions and continents, taking on new forms and variations.

members.entity_description: The widespread increase and spread of urban legends in society and media.
members.resolution_context: This rapid transmission of information has led to the proliferation of urban legends in popular culture, as they are shared and reshared across various platforms and mediums.
